title: Creative Industry Displacement by 2030
description: Projected percentage of creative roles (design, writing, marketing) significantly restructured or eliminated by generative AI by 2030.

sources.title: Future of Jobs Report 2023 — Creative and Media Professions
sources.excerpt: Graphic designers, copywriters, and marketing analysts are among the roles employers expect to decline most rapidly due to generative AI.

sources.title: The economic potential of generative AI — Creative work
sources.excerpt: Generative AI could automate 25-40% of time spent on creative tasks, fundamentally changing the economics of content production.

sources.title: Adobe Future of Creativity Survey 2024
sources.excerpt: 74% of creative professionals report using AI tools. 30% say AI has reduced the scope of work they're hired for.

sources.title: Upwork Q2 2024 Earnings — Freelancer Market Trends
sources.excerpt: Writing and translation freelancer earnings declined 30% YoY. Graphic design jobs fell 17%. AI-augmented creative roles grew 45%.

sources.title: Generative AI and Creative Work: Evidence from Freelance Platforms
sources.excerpt: Image generation AI reduced demand for freelance illustrators by 21% within 12 months of widespread availability.

sources.title: Creative studios slash headcount as AI tools mature
The Impact of Generative AI on Marketing and Creative Roles
sources.excerpt: By 2028, 20% of marketing content will be generated entirely by AI. Creative teams will shrink 15-25% but output will increase.

sources.title: Occupational Outlook: Arts, Design, Entertainment, Sports, and Media
sources.excerpt: Graphic designer employment projected to decline 4% through 2033. Technical writers projected flat. New AI-creative hybrid roles growing.

sources.title: Fiverr International 2024 10-K — Market Trends
sources.excerpt: Fiverr reported that AI-related categories grew 55% YoY while traditional writing and basic design categories declined 22%.

sources.title: AI Can Automate Creative Professions, UOC Study Finds
sources.excerpt: Peer-reviewed study finds AI can now automate substantial portions of creative work. Freelance writing gigs dropped 30% post-ChatGPT launch.

sources.title: UNCTAD Report: AI's Displacement of Human Artists and Creators
sources.excerpt: UNCTAD warns of growing displacement of human artists by AI-generated content, with developing-country creative workers most vulnerable to rate compression.

sources.title: New Frontiers: The Origins and Content of New Work, 1940–2018
sources.excerpt: Demand-eroding effects of automation innovations have intensified in past four decades. New work creation has shifted from production to high-paid professional occupations.
